column4: hi I'm trying to use a custom icon but cant seem to get it to work help please?
can some1 help me with using a custom icon
can some1 help me with using a custom icon
with an application launcher in wine
HazeFace: I saved it as an ico and a svg and a png. none of them work. also made sure it was the same size as the other fonts in that folder
what are you trying to do, exactly?
in gnome?
yes
you just click on the icon box and select a supported graphic file: http://drbrainiac.wordpress.com/2007/11/04/how-to-create-custom-desktop-launchers-in-ubuntu-gnome/
thats for older versions of linux
what version are you using? on my 9.04, when i create a custom launcher, i can click on the ugly springboard thing and choose a file to assign as its icon
9.04. i did click the spring, but my custom icon doesnt come up in the menu
you have to change the address to the location of the icon
and it cant be an .ico file
doesnt show up still. even if i hit ctrl-h
the path must be wrong or the file must be invalid, or you dont have proper perms to it, that's the only explanations i can come up with
how do i change the permisions? i am admin on the computer tho so i dont think thats it
and i tried every file extension that has to do with images
you just tell gnome where the dir of the file IS and choose if from the resulting list, if it doesnt like your file's format, or cant read/open it, then it wont show it to you
sigh i give up
thx anyway
sure, sorry
